de.luis.kioskComponents.ePayment

Interface Configuration

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PayConfiguration

    public interface Configuration
    Project: LUIS ePayment

    This interface represents the configuration of the electronic payment device. You always have to create an instance of this class to login to LUIS ePayment.
    All settings done in this class will be persisted in a file, which is normally called zvt.cfg. It is important to describe, how LUIS ePayment will lookup the name and path of this file.

    • If you create an instance without Parameter (new PayConfiguration() or new PayConfiguration(null)), LUIS ePayment will look for a configuration in the following places and in exactly this sequence:
      • LUIS ePayment looks for the registry path [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\LUTZ Informationssysteme GmbH\de\luis\kioskComponents\LUIS_ePayment cfg="..."].
      • If this entry exists and if this entry contains an existing file, LUIS ePayment will use this file as the configuration file.
      • >If this entry exists but has no legal value or the file doesn't exist, a ConfigException is thrown.
      • If this entry doesn't exist, LUIS ePayment looks for a file named ./zvt.cfg in the local path, i.E. in the path of the working directory of the application, where LUIS ePayment is embedded in.
      • If such a file exists, it will be used.
      • Otherwise it will be created.
    • If you create an instance with Parameter (new PayConfiguration(filename)), this parameter will be checked first.
      • If filename exists, this filename will be used as config file.
      • Otherwise a ConfigException is thrown.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.16 $
    Author:
    M. Gelfort
    See Also:
    PayConfiguration

      • reload

        void reload()
        Discards any previously read settings in main memory and reads the config file or registry again.

      • getConfigFile

        java.lang.String getConfigFile()
        Returns the name of the config file. This file contains all configuration properties of one EFT device as a key = value list. This file can be modified by any editor. The name of the file is given in the load() method. Use only slashes (no backslashes) for a qualified path.
        Returns:
        The name of the config file.

      • setMerchantData

        void setMerchantData(java.lang.String carrier,
                     java.lang.String company,
                     java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.String street,
                     java.lang.String location)
        Method to overwrite the merchant data for the payment terminal.

        config file key possible values default value
        MerchantData1 = carrier
        MerchantData2 = company
        MerchantData3 = name
        MerchantData4 = street
        MerchantData5 = location
        Parameters:
        carrier - first line of the merchant data.
        company - second line of the merchant data
        name - third line of the merchant data
        street - fourth line of the merchant data
        location - last line of the merchant data

      • setPhoneConnection

        void setPhoneConnection(java.lang.String phone1,
                        java.lang.String datex1,
                        java.lang.String phone2,
                        java.lang.String datex2,
                        java.lang.String prefix)
                 throws ConfigException
        Mandatory value (if EFT is connected to the network provider via ISDN).
        Sets all phone numbers for the payment terminal. Most payment terminals have 2 pairs of numbers:
        • first Datex/P + ISDN number
        • second Datex/P + ISDN number
        There is also a fifth number, which allows to specify the prefix, to connect to the outline.

        config file key possible values default value
        Call1 = datex1
        Call2 = phone1
        Call3 = datex2
        Call4 = phone2
        Call5 = prefix
        Parameters:
        phone1 - first phone number.
        datex1 - first Datex/P number.
        phone2 - second phone number.
        datex2 - second Datex/P number.
        prefix - prefix for the outline.
        Throws:
        ConfigException

      • getIsdnUserData

        java.lang.String getIsdnUserData()
        A string for user data (typically "POSK" or "POSK7T") for x25 connection. This value is only relevant for EFTs with ISDN-connection to the network provider.

        config file key possible values default value
        UserData
        Returns:
        The x25 user data.

      • setLANConnection

        void setLANConnection(java.lang.String ip1,
                      java.lang.String port1,
                      java.lang.String ip2,
                      java.lang.String port2)
        Mandatory value (if EFT is connected to the network provider via LAN).
        Defines the LAN connection settings for the payment terminal.
        These settings take only place in a payment terminal with LAN access. You also have to specify the correct network configuration.

        config file key possible values default value
        IP1 = ip1
        PORT1 = port1
        IP2 = ip2
        PORT2 = port2
        Parameters:
        ip1 - The first ip address
        port1 - The first port
        ip2 - The second/alternate ip address
        port2 - The second/alternate port

      • getLanSubnetMask

        java.lang.String getLanSubnetMask()
                           throws ConfigException
        Mandatory value (if EFT is connected to the network provider via LAN).
        The subnet mask of the local IP of the EFT device. DHCP is NOT supported. This value is only relevant for EFTs with LAN-connection to the network provider.

        config file key possible values default value
        IPSubnetMask "255.255.255.0"

        The subnet mask
        Throws:

      • getAllowedCards

        java.lang.String getAllowedCards()
        A possible filter to limit the access of cards for a payment transaction.
        Today, only "0x60" is allowed (i.e. all cards are allowed).

        config file key possible values default value
        Card 0x60
        Returns:
        The filter to limit the access of cards for a payment transaction (only "0x60" by now).

      • setAllowedCards

        void setAllowedCards(java.lang.String cardType)
        A possible filter to limit the access of cards for a payment transaction. Today, only "0x60" is allowed (i.e. all cards are allowed).

        config file key possible values default value
        Card 0x60
        Parameters:
        cardType - Today only "0x60" is allowed

                         throws ConfigException
        Mandatory value.
        The PIN of the merchant to grant access to the payment terminal.

        config file key possible values default value
        MerchantPIN
        Returns:
        The encrypted PIN of the merchant to grant access to the payment terminal. It is not possible, to get the unencrypted PIN.
        Throws:
        ConfigException

      • setMerchantPIN

      • getTimeoutISOLayer

        int getTimeoutISOLayer()
        ISO2 is the standard communication protocoll for several payment terminals.
        This value sets the timeout to handle one command within the payment terminal.
        After this timeout (in seconds), an Exception will be thrown.

        config file key possible values default value
        TimeoutMat7000 65
        Returns:
        the timeout (in seconds) to handle one command within the payment terminal.

      • setTimeoutISOLayer

        void setTimeoutISOLayer(int sec)
        ISO2 is the standard communication protocoll for several payment terminals.
        This value sets the timeout to handle one command within the payment terminal.
        After this timeout (in seconds), an Exception will be thrown.

        config file key possible values default value
        TimeoutMat7000 65
        Parameters:
        sec - the timeout (in seconds) to handle one command within the payment terminal.

      • getCurrency

        java.lang.String getCurrency()
        Configures the currency of the EFT as a hexadecimal value. See ISO-4217 for further details (EUR=0x0978, GBP=0x826).

        config file key possible values default value
        Currency 0x0978
        Returns:
        The currency of the EFT as a hexadecimal value.

      • setCurrency

        void setCurrency(java.lang.String currency)
        Configures the currency of the EFT as a hexadecimal value. See ISO-4217 for further details (EUR=0x0978, GBP=0x826).

        config file key possible values default value
        Currency 0x0978
        Parameters:
        currency - The currency of the EFT as a hexadecimal value. Actually only "0x0978" (=EUR) is supported.

      • getSerialPort

        java.lang.String getSerialPort()
        The name of the serial port, where the payment terminal is connected.
        Sample values are "COM2", "USB003" or "/dev/ttyS1".

        config file key possible values default value
        COMPort "COM1"
        Returns:
        The name of the serial port.

      • getNetworkConnection

        java.lang.String getNetworkConnection()
                               throws ConfigException
        Specifies the way, the payment terminal connunicates with its network provider.
        Possible values are
        • ISDN EFT communicates directly via ISDN with the network provider
        • ISDNviaSeriell EFT sends its data to ePayment, which uses CAPI to communicate with the network provider
        • LAN EFT communicates directly via LAN with the network provider

        config file key possible values default value
        NetworkConnection {ISDN,
        ISDNviaSeriell,
        LAN}        		 "ISDN"
        Returns:
        The kind of communication with the network provider
        Throws:
        ConfigException

      • setNetworkConnection

        void setNetworkConnection(java.lang.String name)
        Specifies the way, how the payment terminal connunicates with its network provider. Possible values are
        • ISDN EFT communicates directly via ISDN with the network provider
        • ISDNviaSeriell EFT sends its data to ePayment, which uses CAPI to communicate with the network provider
        • LAN EFT communicates directly via LAN with the network provider

        config file key possible values default value
        NetworkConnection {ISDN,
        ISDNviaSeriell,
        LAN}        		 "ISDN"
        Parameters:
        name - The kind of communication with the network provider

      • getCardReaderConnection

        java.lang.String getCardReaderConnection()
        Defines the way, a card reader is connected to the device.
        • PC use this value, if the card reader is directly wired to the PC.
        • Controller when the card reader is connected to a controller unit/LI>
        • PINPad when the card reader is connected to the PINPad, which is connected to a controller unit/LI>

        config file key possible values default value
        CardReaderConnection "Controller"
        Returns:
        The way how the card reader is connected to the device.

      • setCardReaderConnection

        void setCardReaderConnection(java.lang.String name)
        Defines the way, a card reader is connected to the device.
        • PC use this value, if the card reader is directly wired to the PC.
        • Controller when the card reader is connected to a controller unit/LI>
        • PINPad when the card reader is connected to the PINPad, which is connected to a controller unit/LI>

        config file key possible values default value
        CardReaderConnection "Controller"
        param name The way how the card reader is connected to the device.

      • getPinpadConnection

        java.lang.String getPinpadConnection()
        Defines the way, a pinpad is connected to the device.
        • Controller when the pinpad is connected to a controller unit/LI>

        config file key possible values default value
        PinpadConnection "Controller"
        Returns:
        The way how the card reader is connected to the device.

      • isDisplayMessages

        boolean isDisplayMessages()
        Some payment terminals allow sending display messages (the text, which is shown at the PINpad display) to the application. These texts can be received and used for example by showing them in a dialog box at the PC display.
        This flag switches this feature on (=true) or off (=false).

        config file key possible values default value
        DisplayMessages {true,
        false}        		 true
        Returns:
        flag to switch on (=true) or off (=false) receiving display messages

      • setDisplayMessages

        void setDisplayMessages(boolean flag)
        Some payment terminals allow sending display messages (the text, which is shown at the PINpad display) to the application. These texts can be received and used for example by showing them in a dialog box at the PC display.
        This flag switches this feature on (=true) or off (=false).

        config file key possible values default value
        DisplayMessages {true,
        false}        		 true
        Parameters:
        flag - flag to switch on (=true) or off (=false) receiving display messages

      • getDisplayLanguage

        java.lang.String getDisplayLanguage()
        On some pinpads, the text displayed can be localized for different countries. The value for the language is defined in ISO639. Samples: "en" for English, "de" for german, "fr" for french.
        See ISO639 for further details.

        config file key possible values default value
        DisplayLanguage {true,
        false}        		 "de"
        Returns:
        The ISO639 string for the language code

      • setDisplayLanguage

        See ISO639 for further details.

        DisplayLanguage "de"

        CheckRemovalProtection {true,
        false}        		 false

        false}        		 false

      • getLowBusyCounter

        int getLowBusyCounter()
        A timeout counter for intermediate messages of normal running commands. Because intermediate messages arrive on most EFT every 60 sec, this is a timeout in unit of minutes as well.
        config file key possible values default value
        LowBusyCounter 3
        Returns:
        A timeout counter for intermediate messages of normal running commands.

      • setLowBusyCounter

        void setLowBusyCounter(int val)
        A timeout counter for intermediate messages of normal running commands. Because intermediate messages arrive on most EFT every 60 sec, this is a timeout in unit of minutes as well.
        config file key possible values default value
        LowBusyCounter 3
        Parameters:
        val -

      • getHighBusyCounter

        int getHighBusyCounter()
        A timeout counter for intermediate messages of long running commands. Because intermediate messages arrive on most EFT every 60 sec, this is a timeout in unit of minutes as well.
        config file key possible values default value
        HighBusyCounter 15
        Returns:
        A timeout counter for intermediate messages of long running commands.

      • decryptMerchantJournal

        void decryptMerchantJournal(java.lang.String outFilename)
                     throws ConfigException,
                            CryptingException
        Method to decrypt an encrypted merchant journal.
        Parameters:
        outFilename - The name of the file, that saves the decrypted merchant journal.
        Throws:
        ConfigException - This exception will be thrown, if the merchant journal is not encrypted.
        CryptingException - This exception signals some problems during the decryption process.

      • decryptMerchantJournal

        void decryptMerchantJournal(java.lang.String inFilename,
                            java.lang.String outFilename)
                     throws ConfigException,
                            CryptingException
        Method to decrypt an encrypted merchant journal.
        Parameters:
        inFilename - The name fo the encrypted merchant journal. If the file ends with ".gz", it will be unzipped and afterwards decrypted.
        outFilename - The name of the file, that saves the decrypted merchant journal.
        Throws:
        ConfigException - This exception will be thrown, if the merchant journal is not encrypted.
        CryptingException - This exception signals some problems during the decryption process.
